item.text: Is there evidence to support BRCA1/2 and other inherited breast cancer genetic testing for all breast cancer patients?
Have you undergone any genetic testing for hereditary cancer predispositions?
Do you have a family history of breast, ovarian, or colorectal cancer?
Are you aware of any genetic mutations in your family that are associated with cancer?
Have you been diagnosed with or treated for any form of cancer?
Do you have a personal or family history of pheochromocytoma or paraganglioma?
Have you been tested using a multigene panel for cancer risk assessment?
Do you have Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry, which is associated with a higher prevalence of certain BRCA mutations?
Are you considering genetic testing to determine your risk of hereditary cancer?
Have you discussed the results of any genetic tests with a genetic counselor or healthcare provider?
